sections.title: Function

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: Applicable because the article discusses a gene, which typically requires an infobox.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: There is no infobox present in the section discussing the ADCYAP1 gene.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: The absence of an infobox indicates no adherence to this requirement.
requirement_evaluations.overlap_notes: An infobox could summarize key facts, which are currently only in the text.

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: Applicable when an infobox is relevant to provide a summary of key facts.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: No infobox to provide concise summaries of key facts.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: Full lack of a summary through an infobox indicates no adherence.
requirement_evaluations.overlap_notes: An infobox would reduce the need for redundancy in summarizing key facts.

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: Applicable to all articles as a standard to include an infobox at the top.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: The article does not include any infobox at the top section.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: Non-conformance due to the absence of the essential infobox.
requirement_evaluations.overlap_notes: Including an infobox would organize factual data more effectively.

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: Applicable as the ADCYAP1 is a gene with a human ortholog; should use Infobox GNF protein.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: The content lacks an Infobox GNF protein related to the human ortholog.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: The infobox type required for this hierarchy level is missing, yielding zero adherence.
requirement_evaluations.overlap_notes: Implementing this infobox type would align with format consistency.

sections.meta_notes: The section lacks an infobox, which is crucial for summarizing key facts and meeting article format standards. Adding one could also help with organizing information in a more reader-friendly manner.
